nz.org.venice.ui
Class SecondaryProgressDialog

java.lang.Object
  nz.org.venice.ui.SecondaryProgressDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProgressDialog
public class SecondaryProgressDialog
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgressDialog

This class is a proxy to the PrimaryProgressDialog class.

See ProgressDialogManager for details about using progress dialogs in venice.

Constructor Detail

SecondaryProgressDialog

public SecondaryProgressDialog(PrimaryProgressDialog primaryProgressDialog)
Create a new Secondary Progress Dialog. This will actually create a proxy to the PrimaryProgressDialog. The purpose of this proxy is that it contains the logic to test whether or not it has the authority to change the real progress dialog. The Secondary Progress Dialog is returned when the programme calls ProgressDialogManager.getProgressDialog() and there is already a progress dialog up.

If this is the case, it might not be able to have full control over the progress dialog.

Parameters:
primaryProgressDialog - the progress dialog we are proxying

public void show(java.lang.String title)
Show the dialog window.

Specified by:
show in interface ProgressDialog
Parameters:
title - the title should be set to the task that we are performing, which is not necessarily the action we are waiting for. e.g. the task might be "Graph CBA", but the action we are waiting for would be "Load CBA Quotes".

isIndeterminate

public boolean isIndeterminate()
Return whether the dialog is indeterminate. An indeterminate progress does not given the user any indication of when the task might be completed.

Specified by:
isIndeterminate in interface ProgressDialog
Returns:
true if no progress is displayed
